Name: Statuette of a sparrow hawk
Description: The sparrow hawk, also known as the Akhom-falcon, is perched on a convex curved base painted yellow. The body has no limbs, and the facial markings are those of a falcon. There is a wide yellow collar around chest and wings. Back, wings and tail are covered by a blue net.Carved birds like this one were part of the tomb equipment in the Late Period. They were placed on mummiform coffins, canopic chests, funerary stelae and on the bases of Ptah-Sokar-Osiris statues, and protected the deceased with their magic.
